Key Match Events: Christos Tzolis scored for Greece with a shot from outside the box, Neuer made a double save but failed to clear the rebound which Giorgos Masouras capitalized on.
Kai Havertz equalized for Germany with a volley that took a deflection off a Greece defender.
Pascal Gross scored a stunner in the 89th minute to give Germany the win.
Post-Match Reflections: Manuel Neuer's mistake led to the opening goal, which could be concerning ahead of Euro 2024.
Kai Havertz was praised for his work rate and equalizer, potentially ticking all the boxes his manager would want.
Julian Nagelsmann's team dominated possession but struggled to create clear-cut chances until the second half.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Christos Tzolis had a one-on-one with Neuer but was denied twice.
Germany's defense looked shaky at times, particularly after Neuer's mistake.
